normalized_poster.payload_xml: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <ecoregion_poster continent="Africa" poster_title="Many Worlds, One Africa"> <ecoregion entry_number="1"> <ecoregion_name>High Atlas Mountains (Morocco)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/morocco-high-atlas-mountain-range-springtime-1719175111</image_url> <description>Red, rugged peaks rise above Berber villages; snow, eagles, and deep gorges reward mountain explorers.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="2"> <ecoregion_name>Sahara Desert</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/sahara-desert-130839674</image_url> <description>Vast dunes and stone plains bake by day, freeze by night; oases and caravans keep life moving.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="3"> <ecoregion_name>Nile River Valley (Egypt)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/cairo-aerial-panorama-nile-downtown-buildings-1731162052</image_url> <description>A green ribbon through desert sands, the Nile feeds farms, towns, and ancient temples along its banks.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="4"> <ecoregion_name>Sahel (Mali & West Africa)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/dogon-village-1-145741385</image_url> <description>Between Sahara and savanna, thorny acacia and grasslands endure drought, grazing herds, and shifting seasons.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="5"> <ecoregion_name>Niger River & Inner Delta</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-view-niger-river-niamey-764929678</image_url> <description>When Niger floods, dry Sahel becomes wetlands—fish, birds, and farmers thrive in the temporary delta.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="6"> <ecoregion_name>Southern Sahara Fringe (Niger)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/desert-niger-niamey-trees-sand-hot-1241730406</image_url> <description>Sand meets scrubby savanna near Niamey; nomads and camels cross dunes under wide, blazing skies.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="7"> <ecoregion_name>Ethiopian Highlands (Simien)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-panorama-semien-mountains-valley-around-1088830448</image_url> <description>Sheer cliffs and high meadows crown the Roof of Africa, home to geladas and ancient hilltop churches.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="8"> <ecoregion_name>Congo Basin Rainforest</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/amazing-nature-african-congo-wild-africa-539028487</image_url> <description>Steamy, towering trees and dark rivers fill Africa’s green heart—an immense rainforest buzzing with hidden wildlife.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="9"> <ecoregion_name>Bwindi Impenetrable Forest (Uganda)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/landscape-southwestern-uganda-bwindi-impenetrable-forest-1282617385</image_url> <description>Mist and moss cloak steep hills; mountain gorillas, rare birds, and chattering chimps make Bwindi unforgettable.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="10"> <ecoregion_name>Great Rift Valley (East Africa)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/great-rift-valley-tanzania-340852322</image_url> <description>Volcanoes and long lakes carve the Rift Valley; grassy plains draw lions, rhinos, and travelers seeking big horizons.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="11"> <ecoregion_name>Horn of Africa Drylands (Somalia)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-view-hargeisa-biggest-city-somaliland-715621966</image_url> <description>Sun-baked plains and rocky hills hold hardy shrubs and wildlife, shaped by drought and relentless winds.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="12"> <ecoregion_name>Serengeti Savanna (Tanzania)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/wildbeast-migration-serengeti-tanzania-645771073</image_url> <description>Endless golden grasslands thunder with migration—wildebeest and zebra roam, while lions watch from rocky kopjes.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="13"> <ecoregion_name>Namib Desert (Namibia)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/desert-ocean-namib-namibia-08262014-great-1074864338</image_url> <description>Ancient dunes rise beside the Atlantic; fog feeds life, and shifting sands create stark, otherworldly beauty.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="14"> <ecoregion_name>Kalahari Desert (Botswana)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://image.shutterstock.com/image-photo/oryx-botswana-kalahari-desert-africa-600w-250109179.jpg</image_url> <description>A semi-arid thirstland of sand and savanna, where springboks, lions, and people adapt to scarce water.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="15"> <ecoregion_name>Highveld Grasslands (South Africa)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/panorama-highveld-many-pine-tree-plantations-1032914584</image_url> <description>Rolling high plateau grasslands meet summer thunderstorms; wide skies, grazing herds, and open roads define the Highveld.</description> </ecoregion> <ecoregion entry_number="16"> <ecoregion_name>Madagascar Dry Forests (Baobab Land)</ecoregion_name> <image_url>https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/beautiful-baobab-trees-sunset-avenue-baobabs-1669980286</image_url> <description>Madagascar’s dry forests feature towering baobabs and curious lemurs, a strange oasis of life in dust.</description> </ecoregion> </ecoregion_poster>
